Added Tod to CC in case he had any insights.

It can be null if somone sets it to null.  We set it to null on dispose of the 
display but we check isDisposed() before we access it.  Also, we check 
isDisposed() and the thread access in setSynchronizer() so it can only be 
null'd from the UI thread.  Weird.

Moving back to VCM.

My guess is that the stacktrace has been confused by JIT. I've seen other cases 
were an NPE occurs in one place but the stacktrace indicates another. It is 
probably a duplicate of bug 33881 where an NPE is thrown in 
LabelProvider.fireLabelProviderChanged (which is what is invoked inside our 
asyncExec).


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 33881 ***
